item.help: The absolute URL of the page that will be shared. Default value is current URL.
item.name: href

item.help: Selects one of the different layouts that are available for the button.
item.name: layout

item.help: the app ID which you use to initiate the [Facebook JavaScript SDK]. Example : 312440138865038 . This ID have to be same for all instances of the widgets within same Edge phase .
item.name: app_id

item.help: The verb to display on the button. Can be either "like" or "recommend"
item.name: action

item.help: The color scheme used by the plugin for any text outside of the button itself.
item.name: colorscheme

item.help: The absolute URL of the page that will be liked.
item.name: href

item.help: If your web site or online service, or a portion of your service, is directed to children under 13 you must enable this
item.name: kid_directed_site

item.help: Selects one of the different layouts that are available for the plugin.
item.name: layout

item.help: A label for tracking referrals which must be less than 50 characters and can contain alphanumeric characters and some punctuation (currently +/=-.:_)
item.name: ref

item.help: Specifies whether to include a share button beside the Like button
item.name: share

item.help: Specifies whether to display profile photos below the button (standard layout only). You must not enable this on child-directed sites.
item.name: show_faces

item.help: The width of the plugin. The layout you choose affects the minimum and default widths you can use.
item.name: width

item.help: the app ID which you use to initiate the [Facebook JavaScript SDK]. Example : 312440138865038 . This ID have to be same for all instances of the widgets within same Edge phase .
item.name: app_id

item.help: The absolute URL of the page that will be sent.
item.name: href

item.help: If your web site or online service, or a portion of your service, is directed to children under 13 you must enable this
item.name: kid_directed_site

item.help: A label for tracking referrals which must be less than 50 characters, and can contain alphanumeric characters and some punctuation (currently +/=-.:_).
item.name: ref

item.help: the app ID which you use to initiate the [Facebook JavaScript SDK]. Example : 312440138865038 . This ID have to be same for all instances of the widgets within same Edge phase .
item.name: app_id

item.help: The pixel width of the post (between 350 and 750)
item.name: width

item.help: the app ID which you use to initiate the [Facebook JavaScript SDK]. Example : 312440138865038 . This ID have to be same for all instances of the widgets within same Edge phase .
item.name: app_id

item.help: The Facebook.com profile URL of the user to follow.
item.name: href

item.help: The color scheme used by the plugin.
item.name: colorscheme

item.help: Selects one of the different layouts that are available for the plugin.
item.name: layout

item.help: The width of the plugin. The layout you choose affects the minimum and default widths you can use
item.name: width

item.help: Specifies whether to display profile photos below the button (standard layout only). You must not enable this on child-directed sites.
item.name: show_faces

item.help: the app ID which you use to initiate the [Facebook JavaScript SDK]. Example : 312440138865038 . This ID have to be same for all instances of the widgets within same Edge phase .
item.name: app_id

item.help: The color scheme used by the plugin
item.name: colorscheme

item.help: The absolute URL that comments posted in the plugin will be permanently associated with. Stories on Facebook about comments posted in the plugin will link to this URL.Default is Current URL.
item.name: href

item.help: The number of comments to show by default. The minimum value is 1.Default value is 10.
item.name: num_posts

item.help: The order to use when displaying comments .
item.name: order_by

item.help: The width of the plugin. Either a pixel value or the literal 100% for fluid width. The mobile version of the Comments plugin ignores the width parameter, and instead has a fluid width of 100%.
item.name: width

item.help: the app ID which you use to initiate the [Facebook JavaScript SDK]. Example : 312440138865038 . This ID have to be same for all instances of the widgets within same Edge phase .
item.name: app_id

item.help: The domain for which to show activity.Default value is current domain.
item.name: site

item.help: Allows you to filter which URLs are shown in the plugin. For example, if the site parameter is set to 'www.example.com' and the filter parameter was set to '/section1/section2' then only pages which matched 'http://www.example.com/section1/section2/*' would be included in the activity feed section of this plugin
item.name: filter

item.help: A comma-separated list of Open Graph action types to show in the feed.Default value is any action type.
item.name: action

item.help: Determines what happens when people click on the links in the feed.
item.name: linktarget

item.help: Limit the created time of articles that are shown in the feed. Valid values are 1-180, which represents the age in days to limit to.Default value 0 - no limit.
item.name: max_age

item.help: A label for tracking referrals which must be less than 50 characters and can contain alphanumeric characters and some punctuation (currently +/=-.:_).
item.name: ref

item.help: Specifies whether to always show recommendations (Articles liked by a high amount of people) in the bottom half of the feed.
item.name: recommendations

item.help: Show the "Recent Activity" header above the feed
item.name: header

item.help: Color Scheme
item.name: colorscheme

item.help: The height of the plugin in pixels. Default vaule is 300 .
item.name: height

item.help: The width of the plugin in pixels.Default value is 300.
item.name: width

item.help: Display all actions associated with this app ID.
item.name: app_id

item.help: The domain for which to show activity.Default value is current domain.
item.name: site

item.help: A comma-separated list of Open Graph action types to show in the feed.Default value is any action type.
item.name: action

item.help: Determines what happens when people click on the links in the feed.
item.name: linktarget

item.help: Limit the created time of articles that are shown in the feed. Valid values are 1-180, which represents the age in days to limit to.Default value 0 - no limit.
item.name: max_age

item.help: A label for tracking referrals which must be less than 50 characters and can contain alphanumeric characters and some punctuation (currently +/=-.:_).
item.name: ref

item.help: Specifies whether to always show recommendations (Articles liked by a high amount of people) in the bottom half of the feed.
item.name: recommendations

item.help: Show the "Recent Activity" header above the feed
item.name: header

item.help: Color Scheme
item.name: colorscheme

item.help: The height of the plugin in pixels. Default vaule is 300 .
item.name: height

item.help: The width of the plugin in pixels.Default value is 300.
item.name: width

item.help: Display all actions associated with this app ID.
item.name: app_id

item.help: The absolute URL of the Facebook Page that will be liked. This is a required setting.
item.name: href

item.help: Color Scheme
item.name: colorscheme

item.help: For "place" Pages (Pages that have a physical location that can be used with check-ins), this specifies whether the stream contains posts by the Page or just check-ins from friends.
item.name: force_wall

item.help: Specifies whether to display the Facebook header at the top of the plugin.
item.name: header

item.help: Specifies whether to display profile photos of people who like the page.
item.name: show_faces

item.help: Specifies whether to display a stream of the latest posts by the Page.
item.name: stream

item.help: The height of the plugin in pixels. The default height varies based on number of faces to display, and whether the stream is displayed. With stream set to true and 10 photos displayed (via show_faces) the default height is 556px. With stream and show_faces both false, the default height is 63px.
item.name: height

item.help: The width of the plugin in pixels. Minimum is 292.
item.name: width

item.help: the app ID which you use to initiate the [Facebook JavaScript SDK]. Example : 312440138865038 . This ID have to be same for all instances of the widgets within same Edge phase .
item.name: app_id

item.help: Display photos of the people who have liked this absolute URL.
item.name: href

item.help: An Open Graph action type, such as like or customapp:run. Default value is "like"
item.name: action

item.help: Color Scheme
item.name: colorscheme

item.help: The maximum number of rows of faces to display. Note that if there are fewer faces to display than rows specified, the plugin will pick the next lowest number of rows.Default value is 1.
item.name: max_rows

item.help: Controls the size of the photos shown in the plugin.
item.name: size

item.help: Toggles the global count of actions on this URL
item.name: show_count

item.help: The width of the plugin in pixels, minimum of 200.Default value is 300.
item.name: width

item.help: the app ID which you use to initiate the [Facebook JavaScript SDK]. Example : 312440138865038 . Specify this if you want the plugin to display users who have connected to your site using Facebook Login with this api key.
item.name: app_id

item.help: Data Group where to save user information after successful login
item.name: dataStoreGroup

item.help: Login automatically on Page Load without any user action.
item.name: autologin

item.help: If enabled, the button will change to a logout button when the user is logged in.
item.name: auto-logout-link

item.help: Picks one of the size options for the button.
item.name: size

item.help: Determines whether a Facepile of logged-in friends is shown below the button. When this is enabled, a logged-in user will only see the Facepile, and no login or logout button.
item.name: show-faces

item.help: The maximum number of rows of profile photos in the Facepile when show_faces is enabled. The actual number of rows shown may be shorter if there aren't enough faces to fill the number you specify.
item.name: max-rows

item.help: the app ID which you use to initiate the [Facebook JavaScript SDK]. Example : 312440138865038 . This ID have to be same for all instances of the widgets within same Edge phase .
item.name: app_id

item.help: add Additional permissions( the wigets has by default public_profile permission )
item.name: permissions

item.help: Access to a person's primary email address
item.name: email

item.help: This permission lets you post to a person's Facebook Timeline.
item.name: publish

item.help: the app ID which you use to initiate the [Facebook JavaScript SDK]. Example : 312440138865038 . This ID have to be same for all instances of the widgets within same Edge phase .
item.name: app_id

item.help: The main body of the post, otherwise called the status message.
item.name: message

item.help: Link Details
item.name: link_legend

item.help: The URL of a link to attach to the post
item.name: link

item.help: Determines the preview image associated with the link.
item.name: picture

item.help: Overwrites the title of the link preview.
item.name: name

item.help: Overwrites the caption under the title in the link preview.
item.name: caption

item.help: Overwrites the description in the link preview
item.name: description

item.help: Action links are any other links shown below the feed story beside Like and Comment.
item.name: actions_legend
item.prompt: The action links attached to the post

item.help: The name or label of the action link.
item.name: action_name

item.help: The URL of the action link itself.
item.name: action_url

item.help: Determines the privacy settings of the post .
item.name: privacy
